comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Sir William James Bull, 1st Baronet (September 29, 1863 – January 23, 1931), was a British solicitor and Conservative politician. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W.J._Bull

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton (1958-): Thanks for the full name and identifying information.  I checked a file of photographs here in the Prints and Photographs Division and found the photographic print Bain apparently copied from: a card photograph issued by Elliott & Fry of London.  The identification that came with the print confirms the details.  It seems the photo was topical because Bull had just been named to succeed Bonar Law as leader of the Liberals in Parliament; the caption bears the date Jan. 6, 1913.  We'll add information to our source description for this photo and reload to Flickr.
